docs.snippet: LEAD: Forget Oscar and Tony; move over Emmy and Grammy; make way for the Silver Plumes. The foot-high, Tiffany-designed award made its debut at the First Annual Concierge Ball when two concierges and a hotel manager were honored for their ''commit...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Forget Oscar and Tony; move over Emmy and Grammy; make way for the Silver Plumes. The foot-high, Tiffany-designed award made its debut at the First Annual Concierge Ball when two concierges and a hotel manager were honored for their ''commitment to their professional development of the concierge industry.

headline.main: Lifestyle;   A Concierge Means Never Having to Find It Yourself

docs.snippet: LEAD: On a cool, damp and somewhat misty December afternoon, two men walk across a meadow, rifles in hand and hunting dogs baying as they advance toward a cluster of pine trees in pursuit of their prey. The age difference between them is such that...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: On a cool, damp and somewhat misty December afternoon, two men walk across a meadow, rifles in hand and hunting dogs baying as they advance toward a cluster of pine trees in pursuit of their prey. The age difference between them is such that they could be father and son, and the easy familiarity they display toward each other suggests just that.

headline.main: Old Pro, Young Idol Team Up for 'Revenge'

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Is it a coincidence that the stores these days are full of ''country''-inspired furniture (heavy maple tables, dry sinks and roll-top desks), that menus are heavy on grits and blackened everything, and that all the successful young lawyers seem to be wearing suspenders?

docs.snippet: LEAD: Out there in the video marts these days one sometimes gets the feeling that there are more movies for sale than for rent. Hot new titles - the just-released ''Lethal Weapon 2,'' say - are meant to be bought, or so it seems. Rentals, accordin...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Out there in the video marts these days one sometimes gets the feeling that there are more movies for sale than for rent. Hot new titles - the just-released ''Lethal Weapon 2,'' say - are meant to be bought, or so it seems. Rentals, according to several surveys, appear to be shrinking.

headline.main: With Movies For Sale, What Of Rental?
United States Actively Defends Human Rights in El Salvador;   Murder Is the Norm

docs.snippet: LEAD: Stanley and Iris are not the sorts of characters one often meets in movies these days. They're not exactly high-profile types. There are no extraterrestrials in their lives, no vice cops and not much of anything that could pass for comedy of...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Stanley and Iris are not the sorts of characters one often meets in movies these days. They're not exactly high-profile types. There are no extraterrestrials in their lives, no vice cops and not much of anything that could pass for comedy of the thigh-slapping kind.

headline.main: Review/Film;   Middle-Aged and Not Quite Middle Class

docs.snippet: LEAD: To people in the U.S., Central America seems a region of unrelieved violence and insecurity, dominated by extremists and peopled by death squads, drug lords, shadowy agents and assorted pistoleros. To the visitor, Costa Rica thus comes as no...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: To people in the U.S., Central America seems a region of unrelieved violence and insecurity, dominated by extremists and peopled by death squads, drug lords, shadowy agents and assorted pistoleros. To the visitor, Costa Rica thus comes as not just a pleasant surprise but a genuine shock. Wedged between Panama and Nicaragua, this little nation, no bigger than Vermont and New Hampshire, seems literally to revel in democracy.

headline.main: The Editorial Notebook;   Flags! Horns! Costa Rica!
